document.docAuthor: Komai, Tomoyuki, Maenosono, Tadafumi, Saeki, Toshifumi & Naruse, Tohru
document.masterDocTitle: Redescription of the brackish water crab Ptychognathus glaber Stimpson, 1858 based on the topotypic material from the Ogasawara Islands and new record of P. lipkei N. K. Ng, 2010 from Japan (Decapoda: Brachyura: Varunidae)

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Redescription of the brackish water crab Ptychognathus glaber Stimpson, 1858 based on the topotypic material from the Ogasawara Islands and new record of P. lipkei N. K. Ng, 2010 from Japan (Decapoda: Brachyura: Varunidae)

subSubSection.paragraph:
Material examined.
Ogasawara Islands. Chichi-jima Island : CBM-ZC 10765, 3 males (11.5×14.0, 11.5×14.3, 12.2× 15.4 mm ), Kiyose River down stream, Futami Port , 27°05.56’E , 142°11.52’E , intertidal, under rock,
13 July 2009
, coll. T . Komai; CBM-ZC 11394, 1 male 10.4×13.0 mm), 1 female (10.2× 12.5 mm ), same locality,
9 December 2005
, coll. T . Komai; CBM-ZC 11659, 3 males (8.1×10.2, 8.6×10.8, 10.3×13.0 mm), 1 female (10.8× 13.1 mm ), same locality,
10 December 2005
, coll. T . Komai; CBM-ZC 16568, 2 males 11.8×14.3, 12.6× 16.2 mm ), 1 female (10.8× 13.1 mm ), same locality,
15 December 2020
; CBM-ZC 16569, 1 male (11.0× 13.6 mm ), 1 female (8.7× 10.6 mm ), same data, DNA voucher; RUMF-ZC-3616, 1 male (12.4× 15.3 mm ), same locality,
25 June 2010
, coll. Y. Fujita ; RUMF-ZC-5047, 1 male (9.4× 11.4 mm ), Okumura River , Futami Bay , 27°05.93’N 142°12.28’E ,
16 September 2016
, coll. T . Sasaki; RUMF-ZC-3637, 1 male (7.9×10.0 mm), Kopepe Beach,
22 June 2010
, coll. Y. Fujita ; RUMF-ZC-3612, 1 male (12.4× 15.3 mm ), same data. Haha-jima Island : RUMF-ZC-4169, 1 male (14.2× 18.1 mm ), Otani River , Oki Port,
1 March 2015
, coll. Y. Fujita ; RUMF-ZC-4170, 1 female (10.7× 13.2 mm ), same locality and date, coll. R . Yoshida; RUMF-ZC-4171, 1 male (14.9× 18.5 mm ), Koromodate River , Kitako Bay ,
1 March 2015
, coll. R . Yoshida; RUMF-ZC-4172, 2 males (4.2×5.0, 9.2×11.0 mm), 1 female (7.0× 8.4 mm ), same data; RUMF- ZC-4173, 8 males (ca 4.1×5.0 [damaged], 5.1×5.9, 6.4×7.7, 6.9×8.9, 7.7×9.2, 7.7×9.5, 7.8×9.7, 11.7× 14.7 mm ), Kirihama, Higashiko Bay ,
27 February 2015
, coll. T . Sasaki; RUMF-ZC-4167, 1 female (7.8× 9.6 mm ), same locality and date, coll. R . Yoshida; RUMF-ZC-4168, 1 male (10.0× 12.3 mm ), same locality and date, coll. T . Sasaki. Muko-jima Island : RUMF-ZC-5049, 1 male (12.9× 16.1 mm ), western coast of southern peninsula, 27°40.56’N 142°08.37’E ,
7 October 2016
, coll. T . Sasaki. Nakoudo-jima Island : RUMF-ZC-5048, 1 male (7.9× 9.6 mm ), Fukuro Port, 27°37.59’N 142°10.66’E ,
20 September 2016
, coll. T . Sasaki; RUMF-ZC-5095, 1 female (6.1× 4.9 mm ), same locality and date, coll. T . Sasaki et al
.

caption.paragraph:
FIGURE 1.
Ptychognathus glaber Stimpson, 1858
, male (12.6×16.2 mm), Chichi-jima Island, Ogasawara Islands, CBM-ZC 16568. A, habitus in dorsal view; B, habitus in ventral view.

FIGURE 2.
Ptychognathus glaber Stimpson, 1858
, male (12.6×16.2 mm), Chichi-jima Island, Ogasawara Islands, CBM-ZC 16568. A, Carapace with eyes and right antenna, dorsal view (setae on left side of dorsal surface omitted); B, front, antennules and left antenna, anterior view; C, left inferior orbital margin, ventral view; D, thoracic sternites 1–4, ventral view; E, left maxilliped 3, outer view; pleon, outer view.

FIGURE 3.
Ptychognathus glaber Stimpson, 1858
, male (12.6×16.2 mm), Chichi-jima Island, Ogasawara Islands, CBM-ZC 16568. A, left cheliped, merus, ventral view; B, same, chela, outer view; C, left pereopod 4, propodus and dactylus, dorsal view; D, left pereopod 5, propodus and dactylus, dorsal view; E, left gonopod 1, ventral view; F, same, distal part, dorsal view.

FIGURE 4.
Ptychognathus glaber Stimpson, 1858
, female (10.8×13.1 mm), Chichi-jima Island, Ogasawara Islands, CBM-ZC 16568. A, habitus in dorsal view; B, habitus in ventral view.

subSubSection.paragraph: Pereopod 5 having setation similar to preceding pereopods. Merus with shallow transverse groove on subdistally, posterior surface slightly inflated proximally. Carpus with sparse, short, feathered setae on extensor surface. Propodus 1.1–1.2 times as long as wide, with covering of black minute setae and sparse long stiff setae on extensor and flexor surfaces. Dactylus slightly recurved, 0.9 times as long as propodus, 2.1 times as long as basal width.

Male gonopod 1 ( Fig. 3E, F ) slender, slightly curving dorsally, reaching suture between thoracic sternite 4 and 5 in situ; tip roundly truncate, forming short chitinous structure; subdistal lobe obtuse, partially obscured by stiff setae. Gonopod 2 0.25 length of gonopod 1.

caption.paragraph:
FIGURE 5. A–D,
Ptychognathus glaber Stimpson, 1858
, female (10.8×13.1 mm), Chichi-jima Island, Ogasawara Islands, CBM-ZC 16568; E,
Ptychognathus ishii Sakai, 1939
, female (8.6×10.6 mm), Okinawa Island, CBM-ZC 5913. A, carapace with eyes and left antenna, dorsal view (setae on left side of surface omitted); B, left vulva, ventral view; C, left cheliped, chela and carpus, outer view; D, E, pleomeres 3–6 and telson, outer view.

subSubSection.paragraph: Ambulatory legs proportionally shorter than those of males; minute stiff setae on surfaces generally fewer than in males; tomentum on carpi, propodi and dactyli less developed than in males.
Distribution. Presently known only from the Ogasawara Islands: Chichi-jima, Haha-jima, Muko-jima and Nakoudo-jima islands.

Habitat. At Kiyose River in the Futami Port, Chichi-jima Island, individuals of
Ptychognathus glaber
are seen in tidal area of the river mouth, which are hidden under rocks on sand at daytime. Other decapods, which are seen around the habitat of
P. glaber
, include:
Caridina typus
(H. Milne Edwards) (Caridea: Atyidae );
Clibanarius longitarsus (de Haan)
(Anomura: Diogenidae );
Metopograpsus thukhar (Owen)
(Brachyura: Grapsidae ); Orisesarma magnum (Komai & Ng) (Brachyura: Sesarmidae ) and
Pseudohelice quadrata (Dana)
(Brachyura: Varunidae ).
